items.title: In step toward controlling chemistry, physicists create a new molecule, atom by atom
items.summary: Physicists have discovered a unique new molecule that could lead to many useful applications, and show how chemical reactions can be studied on a microscopic scale using tools of physics.

alternate.title: In step toward controlling chemistry, physicists create a new molecule, atom by atom

items.title: Insulin therapy initially declined and delayed by an average of two years
items.summary: Thirty percent of type 2 diabetic patients don't begin insulin when it's initially recommended, with the average start time being two years later.

alternate.title: Insulin therapy initially declined and delayed by an average of two years

items.title: Synaptic receptor mobility: Discovery of a new mechanism for controlling memory
items.summary: A new mechanism has been discovered for storing information in synapses and a means of controlling the storage process. The breakthrough moves science closer to unveiling the mystery of the molecular mechanisms of memory and learning processes.

alternate.title: Synaptic receptor mobility: Discovery of a new mechanism for controlling memory

items.title: The return of the comet-like exoplanet
items.summary: Astronomers have focused the Hubble Space Telescope on an exoplanet that had already been seen losing its atmosphere, which forms an enormous cloud of hydrogen, giving the planet the appearance of a giant comet. During earlier observations, it was not possible to cover the whole cloud, whose shape was predicted by numerical simulations. Thanks to these new observations, the scientists have finally been able to confirm the initial predictions.

alternate.title: The return of the comet-like exoplanet

items.title: 'Handedness' in scale-eating fish: Nature and nurture
items.summary: Lateralized behaviors are thought to be strengthened during development. However, little is known about how they are acquired during development. In the scale-eating cichlid model, researchers demonstrated the attack side preference of juveniles was developed with scale-eating experience, regardless of age. They also found that kinetics of attack behavior is superior on one side by nature. Therefore, they concluded that the fish learn to use the naturally dominant side through experience.

alternate.title: 'Handedness' in scale-eating fish: Nature and nurture

items.title: Could interstellar ice provide the answer to birth of DNA?
items.summary: Molecules brought to Earth in meteorite strikes could potentially be converted into the building blocks of DNA, researchers have shown.

alternate.title: Could interstellar ice provide the answer to birth of DNA?
